title: 115_s170
content: The Act titled "Combating BDS Act of 2017" allows state and local governments to divest from entities involved in boycott, divestment, or sanctions against Israel. State and local governments can adopt measures to divest assets, prohibit investments, or restrict contracts with entities engaging in boycotts, divestments, or sanctions against Israel. This is in accordance with the "Combating BDS Act of 2017." State and local governments must meet specific requirements when adopting measures under the "Combating BDS Act of 2017." These requirements include providing written notice, implementing the measure no earlier than 90 days after notice, and allowing entities to comment in writing to demonstrate they have not engaged in boycotts, divestments, or sanctions against Israel. The "Combating BDS Act of 2017" outlines that state or local governments should not adopt measures targeting entities engaged in boycotts, divestments, or sanctions against Israel without verifying their involvement. Additionally, these governments must notify the Department of Justice within 30 days of adopting such measures. The "Combating BDS Act of 2017" requires state or local governments to notify the Attorney General about measures targeting entities involved in boycotts against Israel within 30 days of adoption. Any measure consistent with the Act is not preempted by Federal law, and it applies to measures adopted before, on, or after the Act's enactment. State or local governments can enact measures despite any other provisions, except as specified. (g) Rules of Construction.-- Nothing in this section shall abridge a State's authority to enforce rules on the safety, soundness, and solvency of financial institutions or insurance businesses. The McCarran-Ferguson Act governs the business of insurance. The policy of the United States on the Arab-Israeli conflict remains unchanged. State measures on boycotts, divestment, or sanctions targeting Israel are not preempted. Definitions include assets. In this section, "assets" refer to pension, retirement, annuity, or endowment funds controlled by State or local governments, excluding employee benefit plans covered by ERISA. "Boycott, divestment, or sanctions activity targeting Israel" includes actions intended to harm Israel or businesses operating there. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of "entity" and "investment" in relation to commercial relations with Israel or Israeli-controlled territories. It includes various types of entities and investments such as corporations, governmental entities, loans, and contributions of funds or property. The curr_chunk defines "State" and "State or local government" in relation to commercial relations. It includes States, territories, local governments, and governmental instrumentalities. SEC. 3. Safe Harbor for Changes of Investment Policies by Asset Managers. Amendment to the Investment Company Act of 1940 to include engaging in boycott, divestment, or sanctions targeting Israel as described in the Combating BDS Act of 2017.
